ARABIC: وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And Ayyub when he called out to his Lord, 'Great harm has afflicted me and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful,'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Remember) Job when he called to his Lord: "I am afflicted with distress, and You are the most compassionate of all."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job. Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When Job prayed, "Lord, I have been afflicted with hardships. Have mercy on me; You are the Most Merciful of those who have mercy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And remember Ayyub (Job), when he called his Lord that, “Hardship has afflicted me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who have mercy.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) Ayyub, when he cried to his Lord: "Verily, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who show mercy."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And Ayub, when he cried to his Lord, (saying): Harm has afflicted me, and Thou art the most Merciful of the merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And Job -- when he called unto his Lord, 'Behold, affliction has visited me, and Thou art the most merciful of the merciful.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me, and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Remember Job when he called on his Lord saying, "I have been afflicted with great distress: but You are the most merciful of the merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And Ayyub! recall what time he cried unto his Lord: verily hurt hath touched me, and Thou art the Most Merciful of the mercifuls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And [remember] Job, when he called out to his Lord, ‘Indeed distress has befallen me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And (remember) Job, when He cried to his Lord, "Truly distress has seized me, but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) Ayub (Job), when he cried to his Lord: "Verily, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who show mercy."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And Job when he called to his Lord: 'Affliction has befallen me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Job, when he cried out to his Lord: “Great harm has afflicted me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:83] And, mention, Job (Ayyūba, is substituted by [the following, idh nādā rabbahu …]) when he called out to his Lord — after he had been afflicted with the loss of all of his possessions and children, the laceration of his body, his being shunned by all except his wife, for a period of thirteen, seventeen, or eighteen years, as well as [the affliction of enduring] a straitened means of livelihood — ‘Indeed (read annī because of the implicit yā’ [of the first person pronoun]) harm, adversity, has befallen me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Job) and mention Job, (when he cried unto his Lord) when he prayed to his Lord, ((saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me) suffering has visited my body, so have mercy on me and deliver me, (and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy).
